-OKpmlx8NOBa5VtyL2mc9Q.text: Really like this place. Perfect for breakfast or lunch. Nice for meetings. It's not too cheap, but also not too expensive or fancy. Just a regular sit down place in Soho with really good food and service -  and sometimes that's all you need.

ZcpZOFB6Uyn6uepVdXPvyw.text: We loved it! Super cool space, love all the stuff in the market area - great food! Also in such a good area. Must go!

1Q2V8BpSvb5t7mPvk9J5yw.text: Bog standard brunch - bloody mary, full english, eggs bubble and squeak etc etc. I had the days special - cod with chorizo which was surprisingly good.

MevpRgkTqTZiJW8KDHMlVg.text: I'm not sure if this is the same chain as the Bill's in Brighton but it's just as good. They do great brunches, light snacks and full meals. The last time I went I had a lovely tuna dish which was on special. The atmosphere is buzzy and it beats Balans any day of the week.

-Lg69O9fEn_I5atIIVVPhA.text: I was quite excited to visit Bill's as a recommendation from a an out of town friend. Boy was the experience a massive let down. I invited two visiting friends to join me for lunch and called to make a reservation. They do not accept lunch reservations however they kindly booked me at their last morning slot and said as long as we arrived close to noon that would be fine. All worked out and we had a table in what became a very busy place within an hour. All signs were good at this point and we ordered. In all fairness the food I did receive was ok. I asked the server about getting a lunch portion of a starter and he said that wasn't possible but that I could proceed with the selected item and then order any additional items later. My friends ordered the mussels and a few other things. Fortunately, they enjoyed what they had however the server never returned to inquire about if I wanted anything else. In addition he never returned with the wine list that was requested. I then asked another server who delivered our food, alas no one ever showed again. By the time our server returned my guests had completed their meals and it was inconvenient to order more food or even the glass of wine I wanted.I left sort of hungry, had no wine but a belly full of disappointment. Unfortunately these things happen y'all and if you dine at Bill's I sure hope your experience is better. Sadly, this American Southerner living in London found no thrills eating at Bill's.

kwHTKC7CMNNqEsV2ri_T2Q.text: I didn't think any breakfast place could hold a finger up to the breakfast club (located a few blocks away) but I must say Bills was great. from the oatmeal to the strawberry lemonade to the proper tea, everything was delicious. I actually ended up going here three times and each time I ordered something new, trying to try as much as possible before my trip came to an end. great service, free wifi, and conveniently located, a must when in London.

Lad4_TegQQXFyzjvSQ8jDA.text: I asked several locals in Soho where to get an English breakfast; all recommended Bill's. It turned out to be the perfect restaurant/upscale coffee shop.  Great breakfasts, great personal service; recommended by server. Initially, because everything was so personalized, I did not realize it as a chain.  It has the personality, service, and food of a place cared for attentively the owner.  We went back there for every breakfast we had.

l64lDtbXLGg-5MQaZs2k_g.text: We stopped in here for breakfast due to some of the reviews on here.  Food was good, great atmosphere and good service.  We enjoyed our meal very much.  I had the English breakfast and my girlfriend had eggs benny.  Menu looked good for lunch and dinner as well and would have liked to return if we had more time.

5YQ4k8_dc9SM4XC7wgcLDA.text: Was in London for a girls weekend, found this place using Yelp!  Warm and welcoming, loved the décor and the breakfast was perfect!

gbuVs4NCVsE7h5X-6A2seg.text: My business partner and I stumbled upon Bill's in a jet lagged stupor 2 days ago...The food is delicious, the staff is helpful and very friendly and miraculously, they serve breakfast until 12:00!  If you are a fan of tea and scones and homemade jams... You will be very happy indeed! Eggs on toast, yes please! Did I mention the staff? The management is doing something very right here, well done. This is our second time back ... And won't be our last

BwoeLhJk9bxJhTk47txE5w.text: Finally found a favorite breaky.  Good tea, fresh OJ, nice bubble & squeak, perfect poached, and American bacon(!) vs rasher. Holy cow. Good.

Fl1Bt-SBaAjayLDuY6Ye8w.text: The food at Bill's was not very good. I thought the service was a bit lacking too but over all a ok place to eat. They are a little bit on the pricey side for TGI Friday style food and drinks. Also they have something they call an 'Optional Discretionary 12.5%  Service Charge'  which they give you no choice on. They just roll it on to your bill which seems not very 'Optional or Discretionary'

JxxGC-z6dibT5cGbfkF16w.text: Good! Large space, nice atmosphere, good service and fresh ingredients. I had the moules et frites and hummus with veggies to start. A very good option in expensive soho.

x6FSJMP9o2ETmFyoi3qB_g.text: The first thing that strikes you when you walk into Bill's is the decor which has a trendy, rustic charm to it. We went to Bills for brunch, I had an Eggs Benedict and my girlfriend the Bill's breakfast. Both were very tasty and very well presented. The Eggs Benedict was one of the nicest I've had. For desert I thought I'd have the Eton Mess which came in a large bowl and could definitely feed two people! The staff were young and friendly and the service was efficient. Recommended ;)

sW0gsu5d17kd4QQ9W8pqWQ.text: A perfect place to spend your lunch break in. Very welcoming and compfy. Good food.

y_nwiB3TNM5Tz4PMfMtbdQ.text: Seriously STOP GOING TO BILL'S.  It's just crap, isn't it?  The food is really rubbish.  I mean seriously.

WmL8YmoSy81bZ7Hk4Tij9Q.text: Good food and service. The vegitarian breakfast and the porrage were very tasty. The atmosphere was great and the music was at the right level, you could hear it and have a conversation.  The seat are comfortable, did not want to get up to leave.  I would suggest this place for when you want to hang out enjoy a meal and chill with friends

PZYKHR-8FbZtGOAlC7HCSA.text: Had an excellent lunch at Bill's yesterday! Looking for a place to eat, so much choice in that area, but we walked by Bills and at 2:30pm it was still really busy so we thought we'd take a chance and it was amazing! Great menu, reasonable prices, friendly service. I wanted to try many items but settled on the mushroom vol-au-vent to start, Bills duck pie, then the eaton mess for dessert. My sisters had the ribeye steak, and special fish and chips. My app was great, light flaky pastry, tons of flavor, really well put together and great combination of flavors. The duck pie was a definite standout, absolutely amazing, wanted to go back and order it again today! My sister (who lives in London) said the ribeye was very good by London standards, as she finds it hard to get a really good steak here. The fish and chips was also great, thick piece of haddock, medium thickness batter, not greasy, fresh cut chips. Eaton mess with mango and passion fruit was divine, super sweet though, good for sharing. Overall it was one of the best meals we've had on our visit so far, definitely recommend.

Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's duck pie - the best!

J44felxabm3B4WqnolXTMA.text: Excellent restaurant! The staff were very friendly & accommodating and the food was really lovely. The menu had a lot of variety so there's something for everyone. Lovely decor & atmosphere inside. I'll certainly be going back there again. A wonderful place to take family & people visiting from out of town.

AZc2T0ubz8KQm5geiXpH5Q.text: Very nice place, perfect location & spot to write / read / study / work / etc etc

R7Fvevk-snzZ4icpf0whWA.text: Tried to go to the breakfast club only to find a massive line of twenty something's. Found Bills instead and boy was I glad! The amount of food given for the price was fantastic. The bacon was cooked perfectly, and my favourite part was that the grilled tomatoes had a tiny bit of pesto on them which was just to die for. Would ABSOLUTELY go back again if I was from London!

8epjYZU7yl8Xv5KTnHB5zA.text: I was excited to try this place based on the review but was highly disappointed.Cons: service was poor, food was overrated. I had Bill's breakfast and the sausage wasn't very good (nothing special at all). Toast was soggy, not fresh and egg was luke warm...Pro: Mushrooms were good.

PMly0-RP5xGBLTWECh2NPw.text: Visiting from the states with friends and we happened upon the place. Top of the line service began at the door and continued through the meal. A fun and interesting menu mixing comfort food and cuisine. Food was just delicious. Two words: just come.

ebzH2UYYUxlSJv8teBwFZA.text: GREAT SERVICE, BEAUTIFUL ATMOSPHERE I'm an American guy who was visiting London. I came here by accident and was impressed with the intimacy of the place. It's pretty romantic. I ordered the Fish pie which was good. I would have liked to see more British food items such as a wide range of pies. As a tourist, I felt like British food was available but not to the extent I was hoping. Especially with trendy spots. The service was very good.

Kj1EJihjwGxgwoYYfaT6bA.text: Our last day in London started out on the early side, and one thing I've learned about London, is that coffee shops and breakfast places are not open for us early risers. Most places don't open till 9:00 a.m. or later! Luckily, we found out about Bill's the night before. This place is a gem among the Soho restaurant scene.Breakfast at Bill's goes anywhere from a basket of toast and pastries with butter and three different jams, to pancakes with strawberries and bananas, to full English plates and various egg dishes, and there are plenty of options for vegetarians.The place is funky and fabulous on the inside with a décor, which must be seen to be appreciated. The music went from Reggie, to Memphis Blues, to Jazz without blinking an eye. The servers were friendly, funny, and at times entertaining as the got down to the funky music. There is no London pretension here, only great food, and great service.If you're an early morning person and are up for some fantastic food, get down to Bill's. One word of warning, they get busy and stay busy, so make a reservation. Food: 5 PawsService 5 PawsOverall Rating: 5 PawsShatasdogbowl

PKOAf-QzO4Vv0ZuJMyjE6Q.text: I don't know why this place has a four star. Food was just mediocre at best. I got the big breakfast with side of crispy potatoes, which i think costed me £9.50. It was meh. The scrambled eggs were overcooked, the crispy potatoes were more like mashed potatoes with crusty skin, and the toast was forgettable. I can't even remember what else was on the plate.I also got the super green smoothie, which was good but a bit small for £3.50. I don't know, is it normal in London? I am not local so i probably shouldn't compare size to price because everything seems pricey here to me compared to singapore.All around i was just not impressed with them. I liked my meal at The Breakfast Club a lot more.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

y86z2Q73As-qPYn6mbZDJQ.text: Music's good. Interior is nice. Cod sandwich was good. Now to the service. Waiter spilled water and used my napkin to wipe it but didn't bring a new one. No big deal. Then he completely forgot my friend's tea. Never arrived. We waited for a good 20min for very basic dishes, i.e. sandwiches, salad and curry. The salad was a disgrace. I'm vegan so the avocado, spinach salad (without bacon or cheese) was recommended to me. What I got was bare spinach and a couple of overripe pieces of avocado thrown together (don't forget I waited 20mins for it). I paid £9 for this. I kinda feel disrespected actually. My friend's chicken curry was basically a children's portion (this is coming from a fellow European). Service was bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. 9 for that.

ySF7CmOaREyFGD8rFF6J7Q.text: Went here today for lunch with the girls and our kiddies.  The waitress was lovely friendly and attentive.  Our dishes came promptly and pretty much together.  No waiting for 10 mins for your friend to be served whilst you eat.I  ordered seabass I found the portion to be small and lacked any real flavour I wasn't left impressed with the dish at all.My daughter had a bowl of pasta from the kids meal it was huge - she loved it.  She has a dairy intolerance so it was really nice when the waitress gave her 3 huge pieces of sliced watermelon (we had a smootie and she saw my daughter had ravished the watermelon on the side) and sorbet for her dessert at no extra charge.My friends had the burger which looked lush I would definately go back and next time probably order that.Overall it was a pleasant afternoon. Thank you :)

aoqiQo5NLFmXTi7ryIhfCA.text: I loved brunch a there when visiting London. Take the porridge! It is my favorite. I also like the green smoothie. The English breakfast is the classic brunch to get. Everything is decently priced.

GOUMwbuItgO0Pxe9ZvP_8Q.text: This place is just great. Great and tasty brunch for under a tenner and who ever would have thought to put basil, eggs, sweet chilli sauce, hummus and guacamole together? This was the standard veggie breakfast and was so far removed from a greasy fry-up. It tasted like it was healthy and fresh, and the eggs were perfectly cooked. I know this is now technically a chain, with quite a few popping up around the city, but you could be fooled into thinking you're in a cosy hideaway spot only you know about. Even on a busy weekend, they appear to always have a table free.I have also been here for the afternoon tea, which was great, and also a steal at £9ish per person and super speedy service.The mains look a bit more expensive (£10-15 per meal), but I bet they're worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast

lqkMSJCYz0_D5r0jFcSHng.text: Cute atmosphere with decently priced food. Had the chicken skewers, tortilla chips/guacamole, rum punch and shepherds pie. My third of the bill was 26 pounds. Definitely would return if in the area.

Ih4mx7jhbddfxHzX3S1XVg.text: We came for a late lunch on a sunny Sunday, so there were already 2 or 3 groups of customers waiting in line.However, our party of 2 got promptly seated within 5 minutes.If you like fruit juice, I recommend the "Bill's raspberry, peach & mangojuice ".I ordered the chicken skewers served with couscous and pita bread. It hit the right spots in my stomach. My friend also enjoyed his salmon dish, which was served with sweet potato fries.Because our main orders took over 30 minutes, the manager offered to comp' the side dishes --- a nice gesture which was appreciated.

ZdZwZDnOg9RNiPt2KfFL3w.text: Great food especially the salad and the soup and I'm a vegetarian and there's a lot of options and my friend prefers the vegetarian stuff it's so better quality

pd0j_zAnfnIRbsxQ4CYkmg.text: Nice find on our vacation in London! Prime location. Good food and service! We had lamb koftas and pen fried  seabass, English tea ( they serve it in a big pot), strawberry eton mess for desert, everything was tasty! Service was wonderful! Would recommend and come back .

Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Fried bass

5rExoakNb07ua1oZZlCz5w.text: ** In all fairness, I'd give this place 2.5 stars, but since yelp doesn't do halves.. **Came here for lunch on a Thursday and just.. no, no, no. At 1pm, the place was PACKED. Which usually is a good sign because something so popular can't be that bad, right? UH, WELL... Looking around the room almost everyone's from out of town. That's not to say tourists don't know what good food is, but more often than not, it tends to mean a lot of hype but little substance.Other reviewers have raved about the decor, but I feel like there's a big difference between that and ambience. They've gone for this whole shabby chic country house vibe and whilst I do enjoy the bunches of hanging chillies, they play awful top 40-type hits that, with the loud chatter, blends into a noisy collective murmur. It's not quite the comfortable, laid-back experience you'd hope for.Service was initially pleasant, if a little awkward. But then they kept trying to serve us food that wasn't ours! Elderflower cordial? Chocolate cake? Fries? UH, NO??? There wasn't even the friendly, oh, my bad. Just lots of standing there looking confused. And when we asked for the bill, it was met with, 'oh would you like to order?' WOW. CLEARLY VERY VERY CONFUSED. I understand, busy shift and all, but we've been sitting here for more than an hour with dirty napkins..I wish I could say the food was redeeming but nope. Here's a quick overview:- Sweet potato fries(unseasoned, lacked any sort of crisping on the outside, didn't go well the tzatziki dip at all? What an odd mix of flavours.)- Halloumi and cous cous salad(Cous cous was so bland. It said 'with tomatoes, mint, pomegranate, parsley, yogurt and lemon' so I expected something punchy and a little 'mediterranean' but no, the only flavour was salty halloumi. I could've done a better job at home.)+ Crab, chilli and prawn cakes.(THIS WAS THE ONLY GOOD BIT ABOUT OUR MEAL! The chilli was undetectable, but at least it was crispy on the outside, soft and seafoody on the inside. With a little tart mango salad to go with.)+ Cod and chips with mushy peas.(Huge portion of fish, the batter wasn't bad but again, soggy fries! Still massively average, but it wasn't 'bad' so I suppose it gets a plus)Admittedly, we probably didn't try any of their winners, like the hamburgers (apparently?) but really, with so many great food places in soho, you don't want to waste your time here. Yes, yes, celebrity chef and all that. But frankly, I haven't a clue who Bill Granger is and if his restaurants are anything to go by, I'm not interested to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. TABLE OF MEH. Soggy sweet potato fries, bland halloumi cous cous salad, but at least the crab cakes weren't bad

ZFl6PcUo7y239FKzRP5Dww.text: Ulrik and I wanted to find a good breakfast joint so I started yelping to find a good place (thank you, guys!). Being on the red line, it took us no time to get there from Notting Hill so we took the tube and stepped in to this charming little place.The decor is so cosy and rustic, you immediately feel you've stepped into a French farmhouse setting with big old oak tables, rustic chairs and big bundles of chili hanging down from the ceiling. I went for the veggie breakfast with avocado, chunky hummus, chili sauce, portobello mushrooms, poached eggs, and gluten free break - and it was seriously one of the best breakfasts ever, even my meat loving husband had food envy. Everything went perfectly together, from the nicely poached eggs with runny centre to the hummus with sweet chili sauce. Even the gluten free bread was juicy and good, well done there.Ulrik went for the more traditional breakfast with sausage, portobello mushrooms, bacon, and eggs, and he really enjoyed his food as well - but we both agreed that the veggie version was the better choice. We also had some tea and coffee as well as carrot-orange-ginger juice - the latter being a bit dull so if want to skip something, go ahead and skip that.

szx9lhk4pMXt615K8Ic_ug.text: I've seen a lot of Bill's since I arrived in London, but I was always reticent to try it, because it's a restaurant chain. But what isn't in London, right ? Finally, I gave it a try for brunch and it was a nice surprise ! My brother had the Full english breakfast while I ordered the pancakes with extra bacon. And if you think that nobody can go wrong with pancakes, trust me, I ate some pretty disappointing pancakes in London. But here, the pancakes were really good, the bacon crispy and I got my extra maple syrup really quick after I asked for it : the waitress was really nice and always available.We also tried the chocolate brownie milkshale and it was heaven ! I will definitely go back, especially if all the Bill's in London are this nice :)

ZNn1jFJm6ZuBaVdPfo0ADQ.text: Amazing for breakfast since I tried breakfast only. I would recommend it to Poached egg lovers and pancake

Z9X8XwCYeLArr2QOJvLWJQ.text: What one thing would I absolutely hate to do tonight, I ask myself as my friends and colleagues hit Soho for a bit of gay eye candy on a whatever Thursday night? The answer, friends, is go to this shit hole. It should be eloquent enough finding a spot that accommodates six humans at 8:30 on Thursday ( ie: the place is shit and no one wants to dine here, leave leave leave before they poison you and charge you for it). Service was horrendous. Some curly haired girl abused us for not ordering enough appetizers since we were drinking ( we had, by the way, with a different server. They are apparently unable to speak to one another in this joint) and then brought us the wrong drinks and cold appetizers. And the FOOD. Oh heavens and angels and things that sparkle... THE FOOD! I ordered a steak, God's easiest fucking dish to make. You take a piece a meat. And ya cook it. BAM. And a salad. It was the worst thing on the planet. I may or may not have lost a molar chewing on the flesh. The tomatoes were soggy. My dinner guests got sweet potato fries with no salt. The salted caramel cake was so stale you could have choked on it. Lord help this place. NEVER oh never again. EVER.

The food was just right (full breakfast) and great for that morning hunger. Good portion and okay price. Had no complaints about service or anything!

m5vo8wH6tJxzxZ6kYYbVnA.text: Love the atmosphere - as large as this restaurant is, it feels like you could be at home. The food was great - everything from sea food dishes to burgers. I was disappointed at their strict limited selection of cocktails, but I must admit, it was the cleanest and best gin & tonic I'd ever had. Cheers to that!

rRC_BwJdaUj_qc4LnGV1kg.text: I have Celiac Disease and was looking for places to eat on the Find Me Gluten Free app and saw this place had great reviews. We went there for breakfast and had a wonderful experience. It can be really hard to find a good gluten free breakfast, but their gluten free breakfast menu is pretty substantial. I had the eggs benedict royale and it was SO delicious. The coffee is tasty, also. The wait staff was very pleasant and helpful when dealing with my dietary needs. They definitely seemed to know what CD is and care, and it shows considering I didn't get sick at all the three separate times we ate there. I will say though, their gluten free menu for the rest of the day isn't to my taste and doesn't seem as satisfying as the gluten free breakfast menu. Just my opinion though. I'm thankful I had a great breakfast place to eat at.

tQRZSmg8QRxkhxHPJlL3WQ.text: This might be a biased review as we were the tired jet lagged Americans looking for a good english breakfast.  Our first stop was the Breakfast Club.  But the line outside had at least 20 people in it.  I think the British are much more used to long queue .  A few more blocks and there was Bill's.  Very well decorated place, not too noisy, immediate seating, prompt seating.  I had English breakfast and She had Avocato toast with eggs and bacon.  Both were really really good.  The food came faster than expected.  They serve on hot plates.  Thats a big one for me.  Promptly billed when asked.  We would definitely come back.

PtDjExt7xrR-YEj3hjGI4Q.text: Meh. It's a lively spot with a nice casual vibe. The avocado toast wasn't very impressive -- while the egg was cooked well, the avocadoes were all all hard and not very ripe. The peach mint tea was basically a strong peach flavor and very little mint. Not a bad spot to rest your feet but not really a spot to go out of your way for.

m0U9kTEuSE66ZiOwjaNT3A.text: Although you may hesitate to go to a chain restaurant, I frequent this restaurant because it has such a versatile menu, they can whip up a really honest mocha (not sweet so you can taste the espresso and cocoa), their pots of tea are incredibly generous for one person (2 bags in a large pot), they do everything from brunch to burgers to fish dishes, and an array of fresh salads. The staff are always super quick to seat you, or try to squeeze you in during busy times, they are all very nice and accommodating, and make sure to clear and clean the tables up to maintain an orderly brand. I enjoy the evenings because they break out the old fashion silver candle holders and give the ambiance a really old fashion and rustic feel. Great for an early morning breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner, or late night dessert or cocktail. Also, during the month of June, if you buy any hot drink whether coffee or tea, they will throw in a free piece of Victoria sponge cake or 2 large raison scones with thick clotted cream and their homemade thick-cut orange or grapefruit preserves. The rinds are candied and really delicious in the jam, and you can even purchase them in-house. Portions are modest (I had a salmon with veg for lunch) so if you come hungry, you may need to order a side or two to split in addition to the entree. Will definitely continue to return at any time of day as it's in a great location on Brewer, a mere stone's throw from Old Compton.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea and scones
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Mocha (not sweet...very good)
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Salmon lunch

BOFKOKI6p5MiNvCwdugZQA.text: This restaurant is a shinning example of how a great restaurant should operate. I was impressed by pretty much everything. I had the opportunity to work near by for about 3 weeks, and initially I wasn't sure about Bill's, it's corner location seemed to be the perfect place for a tourist trap, but one working dinner brought me there, and I became a fan. The staff was friendly and prompt, cocktails are delicious, food is made with care, with fresh ingredients, and in reasonable portions. The Menu, drink list, all tastefully designed, not only that, you can tell it's printed by a respectable printer as well. I'm actually a bit surprised that a place like Bill's is able to survive an area like SOHO.Big fan, mad props to the operator.

OufX-6S_LN363m3_yykgFw.text: Well, this place was decidedly mediocre. Only place we could find with the kitchen open around 10:30 pm. Food and service could have been better given the prices and the location.

-2DoCjjc-JP_VsSIImV7qQ.text: Fresh juices. Good coffee. Delicious eggs Benedict. Comfortable seating. Friendly decor. Lovely staff.Great place for late breakfast.

z9lztk7TEYM3tHe6fm52jQ.text: We ate here three times while on our week vacation in London! Great food with great prices. I recommend trying the Shepard's pie and their breakfast too!

jMyxNRjxRZELgtIyzDFXJw.text: #TriggsEatLondon started with breakfast here at Bills. I went for the vegetarian option while Mrs T had the avocado on toast. Good coffee quickly followed by our meals. I'd chosen the vegetarian break due to the combo of flavors & wasn't disappointed. Humus. Guacamole. Sweet chili sauce. Excellent start to the day. Mrs Ts toast was loaded with avocado & again the flavor from the chili flake and the texture of the poached eggs was unique. Good value especially if you're thinking of paying £20+ for a hotel breakfast in the area. Funky vibe with a wide array of diners & attentive staff. Don't know if consistent across the chain but would definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian breakfast. Great array of flavors for a breakfast. Good start to holiday

DooXKwG2g11V0IWBa2B2UQ.text: We've been here for breakfast and dinner and the food is excellent. The menu is pretty full, so it's hard to believe they do everything so well. They serve bottled beer, wine and cocktails. They have many traditional English dishes such as fish and chips w/ mushy peas, as well as more American style dishes featuring avocados and other fresh ingredient.Service is excellent and we love the home style atmosphere.  Give Bill's a try. You'll love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Table top w/ beer

hI8k5KDmXIPMN1_Gj8XfCg.text: Over hyped and dry. There is absolute nothing special with this place, the food looks ok but dry and tasteless. At princi 5min from this location the service is crap but the food to die for.

m3VwQ2WYVSWDBr_gcXQ2mg.text: This is solely a review of Bill's comparatively inexpensive afternoon tea.£9.95 for an afternoon is without a doubt the least expensive afternoon tea I have seen in London. This is what drew me to Bill's. This, and the cosy candlelit tables framed by retro interiors which I had seen so many times when just passing by.I took my mum and boyfriend here for a treat after New Year. The tea came served in big pots. No leaf tea in sight, just bagged earl grey, but it was fine for the price. I was pleased to see the traditional three-tier cake stands, one for me as the vegetarian, the other two my boyfriend and mum shared. The lower tier was occupied by the finger sandwiches, the middle tier had some interesting cake offerings and upon the top tier rested a couple of traditional scones with clotted cream and jam.We slowly worked our way up. The cream cheese was very fresh and generously spread, but we all agreed that there were too few savoury options, especially after having gorged ourself on the sweet offerings. The aesthetically-pleasing strawberry cream tart was a little on the bland side, whilst the raspberry almond cake was deliciously moist and tart. The scones were just fine. For the price you get the experience and probably diabetes. This is a decent place to have a traditional afternoon tea, but I have learned from the experience: 1.) That I don't have the sweet tooth I thought I did.2.) That I don't really like afternoon teas.If you have to try the afternoon tea before you leave London and don't have the money to throw at one of those sterile, hotel affairs, this might be your ticket. Also, if you do appreciate afternoon tea you will probably quite like this one.

9M5XBOL2qNqc5tPFdHIZ4Q.text: After a long night out the one thing I was craving to beat that hangover was brunch, so I stumbled upon bills as it was recommended and my god it did not disappoint, I ordered avocado and eggs, it was divine, the presentation the poached egg was cooked exactly how I asked for it and chilli flakes on top was just the perfect combination. Highly recommend this place for brunch, it makes me more excited to try different places in London before I return back to Dublin!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

YCfHA5OoedfLZU5rpcbl0Q.text: In short, Bill's was an excellent stop for a delicious luncheon.  Our server, Truly, was a friendly delight, spending time for chit-chat and sharing her music and travels made our meal time feel like being with a friend. Her beer recommendation for my wife was perfect, as was the meal suggestion of chicken skewers. I had the beef stew and left the bowl empty, enjoying it thoroughly! I would highly recommend Bill's to others

SusveWJYYnQET4e61M4LUQ.text: As I was eating my fish pie I was thinking 'I am getting ripped off' its like 12 quid and not massive either. It did fill me up and was tasty I can't lie but for that price I want to be a bit more blown away than just,  'yeah that was alright' the waiter was very friendly...but then with my coke and the service charge my bill was 17 quid. Seemed a bit ridiculous for what I'd had.

FmZmFJ0HqD-WYTR8biIRPQ.text: It's a chain, so, in trying to please the masses, some things can't please everyone. However, the price point is fair, the food is good, and the decor is better than expected for a chain, it still has character, instead of a big-business vibe. Better than expected.

vu1tTiY7diGAA6st0wQ7Gw.text: Nothing exceptional. I got an haddock with fries and mashed peas. The portion was shark fire what it costs. Also disappointment for the fries that have been served in a rusty brick. Where is the Food and drug association looking at when review restaurants?

UuIbXmVSFs4zy2_vVOxwRw.text: Eggs benny on toast? I had slight food envy of my fellow diners and a little self-hatred for not actually reading the menu. This is the first time I've ventured to a Bill's for not-lunch. It was good though, despite my longing for an english muffin. These seem to be popping up all over the place now days. It's nice and big so you don't have to worry about making a reservation or queuing like it's a sport, at least not when we went, which was noon on a sunday.

Z09RWeJNbrEkr7WGnmFeKA.text: GREAT MENU!!  This is the 3rd time ive been to this location and the service has always been nice! The menu has a huge variety!!  At this location, they are always busy , but, we always get in before our time quoted!!  Try their calamari appetizer!! Hungry? Try their Burger and ribs!!!

5JgaXwop_bGoK4NT9rIsfA.text: This place was packed Friday night. An hour wait. Came back on Monday and we were seated right away by the window. An ecclectic decor and to my surprise, there is more than one Bill's in London and in Australia. The food was good, not great, and the service was nice, but I do not like it when the staff is in a hurry to clear the table and it is 10:00 PM with there is no one waiting. Tables were empty, so what is the rush? I had the fish fingers sandwich. That was bigger than thought it would be. It was okay, but not that exciting. Poor beer selection as well. It looked like wine was the alcohol of choice. I heard the risotto was good and I can:t remember what our other friend had, but no one said their dish was really anything, good or bad. We ordered the Eton Mess for dessert. Wow is that sweet, as in too much sugar. I may go back again..

GUUP2PehDS-kG2-9GvJadw.text: I popped into Bill's Soho on Saturday afternoon for a late lunch with my boyfriend. We have been to this branch of the chain previously, but it has been about a year since we last visited. Little has changed at Bill's- this is consistent across all of its branches both inside and outside of London. The menu hasn't varied greatly over the years, but it represents a good 'something for everyone' selection, ranging from burgers (beef and vegetarian/halloumi options) to salads and grills. The food is primarily influenced by British cuisine with some Mediterranean accents with mezze flourishes of hummus and tzatziki. The food is healthy, uncomplicated and fresh. They do a lovely brunch selection that ends much too early (one o'clock) on a Saturday. The décor is the same across all branches with hanging dried chilies and larder-style shelving displaying the Bill's produce that you can purchase, which includes honeys, jams and various preserves and sweets.On this trip, the restaurant was busy and there was a growing queue of people outside the door. We were seated pretty quickly, however, and the atmosphere was buzzy with conversation and a good selection of music playing overhead. The Soho location is superb for people-watching, as you do see such eclectic groups meandering by! Some of the smaller tables are very close together, but this is usual for central London and didn't detract too much from the enjoyment of our meal. Our table service was friendly and our food arrived promptly- I ordered the chicken kebab skewers on a bed of couscous with tzatziki and pitta bread. It was a reasonable portion, but very skimpy on the tzatziki given that I had a good amount of pitta bread. It was a good and standard light lunch choice even if it was a little bland.My partner had the fish finger sandwich with hand-cut fries, which I eyed enviously- the fish fingers were chunky and homemade, served with tartar sauce in chunky bloomer-style bread. My partner didn't ask about a choice of bread and was slightly disappointed that the default was white, but that's only something we noticed because we so rarely eat white bread at home. He enjoyed the dish and happily finished it- it wasn't greasy or soggy and was a much heartier choice than mine.At the end of the meal, it did take us some time to flag down our server to pay, but this again seems to be the trend in busy central London restaurants.Bill's is a good restaurant for friends and family gatherings- it's always lively and the menu should satisfy everyone's tastes. The prices are reasonable and the dessert menu always tempts me with an excellent selection of British puds (eton mess, sticky toffee pudding, etc.). Some of the branches even do an afternoon tea.

OhUWV9XAj4Fv7K1Jxqj1Yg.text: Food was actually rather tasty, the issue I had was with the rest of it... From the street, Bills  looks delightful and the decor is well executed, looks fresh, clean, tasteful,  bit like a Whole Foods little brother store....tinged with an air pretension.  None of the mass of waiters were unfriendly, they were just unable to cope with the busyness. My party (my flatmate and I) was seated quickly at a 4 person, sloping, table and was tended to by a disinterested waiter whose bouts of interest were poorly timed. The menu actually had some good variety and intriguing items. Yet,  it was the menu that most egregiously offended me... ironically.  Let me ask you this: can an English breakfast be "full" without toast and beans?  No. The full English breakfast at Bills amputates the compulsory toast and beans from the £7.95 menu item and offers them up as an extra for an additional £1.  Yes, it's in London, in Soho...I get it, it's expensive,...but squeeze in some toast and beans for heaven's sake, or at least include it in the price! Of course i opted for something else. The mustard bubble and squeak with eggs and ham. Flatmate got the eggs royale. Taste-wise it was good, but the portion sizes were unsatisfying and we were both hungry shortly after...toast would have helped, haha.  There was also this audacious menu/order form in order to have the waiters retrieve items from the retail section and deliver right to your table so you can bring some bills home with you.  I didnt appreciate the presumptuousness of it, considering the overall impression  i got from bills was that of corporate dazzle rather than sincere service.

0J0SwPlgWeuQ-mG6OmtTNw.text: Its a great go to if your in central London, its in Soho so i was skeptical they would get a traditional breakfast right - but its a solid breakfast place with nice decor. Certainly its a chain - but its a good chain and i've never had bad food. Sure you can find a more authentic breakfast - but good luck finding something better nearby.

wzasnvvX_HXlXNW5lamAIw.text: Entering Bills is like entering a south european food marked. Even though it feels busy the atmosphere is welcoming and warm. This is the perfect daytime food place and hangout serving high quality farmers style food, however, I would not go there in the evening.Their locating is just of the very busy Regent Street and Piccadilly Circus, and offers a fresh break in a busy day!

BI_GbFUYRcKdFnHriKJZEw.text: I LOVE Bill's! I've been here multiple times for afternoon tea and for dinner.  The atmosphere is great, the food is good, and the price is very decent!  Bill's is a place I tell everyone who visits London to go to.  The only downside it that it's normally pretty busy.

9vwstSLDxutsOKugG9I8rA.text: Awesome food and service. Hipster vibe, but with great food (as some hipster places tend not to have..). His veggie breakfast was better than my pancakes, but it was so big, he shared. :) Go with veggie breaky even if you're not vegetarian - you won't regret it.

jpSF5Rk0RLDD3o6jVgDAAg.text: real nice fun quirky place to get breakfast - have to admit we went here because the queue for the breakfast club was as ever, very long. but this was a nice surprise. the inside decor is beautiful, really fun and quirky and chic and cool all at the same time. the service was good and the food was decent, there wasnt a huge amount to choose from i personally think, and the prices remember it is london - my friend had a strange houmous vegetarian option breakfast. but the portions were decent and it is a nice place to relax.

i2KvHHDMk0qOmdCzoeom9A.text: Went for breakfast here and was very impressed with the service and atmosphere. Our breakfasts arrived lukewarm which wasn't great, but when we commented to the staff they took them away without fuss and delivered hotter replacements. The new breakfasts were cooked again from scratch rather than just nuked in the microwave and the staff also apologised and took them off the bill, which was a nice surprise. The food itself was yummy and the price average in this area so we will definitely return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

_dgQ7gKS5zjdutGIWKyPhA.text: A great atmosphere; sort of an eclectic/chic/industrial looking interior with a hipster vibe. A good music selection of trendy tunes, mix of indie sounding stuff and a few by the Beatles tossed in there. Surprisingly a large restaurant with entrance on two corners. Was seated by the manager, very friendly girl. I was happy to find the wi-fi code clearly shown on a small chalkboard hanging from the ceiling, among other chalkboards with writing on them.  I ordered an americano, it was perfect, complete with mini carafe of steamed milk.  I also got the cloudy apple juice; also delicious.For breakfast I ordered their Bill's Breakfast with baked beans. I'm visiting London from Canada so this was my first English breakfast experience. I have to say, I've never tasted such delicious sausage as the sausage at Bill's. Soft and juicy. Or maybe all English sausages are this good?Everything came piled on the toast, a really great way to eat breakfast food. The bacon was also very good, nice and greasy. If you're used to "American style" bacon this was more floppy and thick, you may prefer it crispier but I personally liked it how it was cooked at Bill's. I had heard that the English like fried tomatoes, I wasn't sure what to expect but they were great and went well with the cooked mushrooms. Could have done without the baked beans added on to it, they were very basic.It doesn't appear to be much when it's all piled up on the toast but everything was surprisingly filling, I was quite satisfied. All staff was super friendly an easy going! A very warm experience. I'm sure to try this place again while I'm staying in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Breakfast with beans, americano, and large apple juice
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Breakfast with beans, americano, and large apple juice.

AfB1M1AAGEUI5i-ekDVPYw.text: Atmosphere was great, very friendly service and the food excellent.  The chicken liver appetizer was great as was the duck pie...a very good experience.

vruoWRyXSpaGWoqHzGomPw.text: Hands down, this is the perfect breakfast spot. The food is amazing and most of the options are interesting and escape the stereotypical boring cafes' - at many other places you can choose between Full English and eggs; and that's it. Happily, that's not the case with Bill's. In addition to the beautiful selection of food you can order a variety of juices, each and every one of them being refreshing and delicious.

euufdCmg0yLtnKc9gKs1Eg.text: My husband and I ate here about a week ago and absolutely loved it! The service is quick and great. The food is soo delicious & completely unpretentious. Coffee is strong and the atmosphere is welcoming. We couldn't wait to come back today, and I'm sure we'll be back again before heading back to the us.

qGNFl2cWYCzeiT2UEGAlJA.text: We ate here twice in one trip to London -- once for breakfast and once for dinner. Both meals were fabulous - well priced, fresh, with good service. Great vegetarian options. They serve food quite late for the area. Highly recommended!

97iE5Kegy1Ge4fo7W0UrRA.text: Great little restaurant in Soho. Went for a late Saturday night dinner. Cool atmosphere with lots of lit candles everywhere. Reasonably priced food options and wine. Will definitely come back.

5R90-1aJ0ZacSoBYNqnipw.text: This place SUCKS. I came here for breakfast but missed the noontime cut off. Ok, that's on me. I decided to give their lunch/dinner menu a shot because I didn't really have enough time to search out another option.We were greeted warmly enough and told we could sit where we like. Cool. We chose a spot by the window and promptly received some attitude from the waitress for ordering tap water and asking for a minute to decide on the menu. I ordered the open-face steak sandwich, she ordered the steak, eggs and chips. Our food came out cold, the chips tasted old, and I started to wonder why I even paid Bill's a visit in the first place.If you're in the mood for crap service and even crappier food, come to Bill's and you won't be disappointed.

8AoTCzmKCMhfvCGGhzikUw.text: I'm not quite a fan of chain restaurants but Bill's in Sydney impressed me that when I saw a similar signboard, I've always been inkling to try the one in England. This branch drew me in and I was served by a friendly waiter whose big smile got me comfortable. The food turned out to be good and I stuff myself down with a good hearty brekkie with my partner. I got to say, even our coffees were made to perfection in taste and temperature. Definitely will be returning to this place again soon :) KEEP UP THE GREAT FOOD AND SRRVICE!

J_zoG3Iefpc6o0e23_Uf7Q.text: Came here for brunch because the initial restaurant we went to was packed. Ordered the avacado toast. There was way too much avacado for my liking. I also ordered the pancake. It would have bred more enjoyable if there was more syrup.

HBS_OBZOVpPSoOZpfBElxQ.text: What a nice English breakfast I had at Bill's! The waitresses were so nice and I tried for the first time pancakes with syrup and bacon and I wasn't disappointed! Plus the pecan pie is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

B6mhdUGjLGHNDg4eAzMYjA.text: Wow! The eggs Benedict was outstanding! I always say the make or break part of an eggs Benny is the hollandaise (duh!) and theirs was on point. Just enough flavour and zip but not too much to be over powering, perfect creaminess and texture too. The eggs were a perfect medium as well. Hubby had the pancakes which were also excellent.  Great coffee and great service- plus excellent location

Jv8PwM2QqOhHxVksUWe9Cw.text: The food was great - even had a full gluten-free menu for the coeliac in our group - but the service was not. The waitstaff could do with some customer service training.

BHWpgNIlRQMF4dJJkBVvIQ.text: This is probably my favorite place I have eaten on a week long trip to Paris and London. The atmosphere was very pleasant and felt cozy for being a relatively large space. The food was delicious: we started with the chicken skewers, then I had the buttermilk chicken sandwich and my friend had the steak and eggs, then we shared the chocolate bombe for dessert. All were unique dishes that were tasty and filling. The desert was amazing! Drizzling hot Carmel over a chocolate dome onto vanilla ice cream and brownie... doesn't get much better. Not to mention their cocktail selection was fantastic. I got their special, the name is escaping me but all around great food, great service, great vibes.
