Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Buttermilk chicken sandwich
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. 1 of 3 of the chicken skewers... ate them too quickly to get a picture

d5CMO5qZpI-_n_7I81e_Ww.text: Dissapointing. Usual selection of dishes with nothing to make it special. Having tried the burger, I would say that it is of really poor quality. Nice interiors, located in the centre of Soho, and having friendly staff working here sounds like an ideal choice for your next lunch/dinner in central London. But unfortunately doesn't manage to impress with the dishes and the quality of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

fGjw0DcUo1Qt7y1_RUEoiQ.text: The ambience of this place is great with a very vintage, diner feel to it. They are very straight forward with allergens in their food and accommodate for those with gluten or dairy allergies. The service was fast and our server was very attentive! I had eggs royale which was a twist on Eggs Benedict with salmon - great British twist to the dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The Eggs Royale!

oW8kbqxOQjCcCoAnd5MKQQ.text: Found Bill's on Yelp and went in for a quick breakfast.  Had Bill's breakfast and really enjoyed the combination and flavor.

3d82yuqwRi6osMT3sCzjcg.text: Since Bill's is a chain restaurant (I'm a food snob), I was a bit skeptical at first but since every other place in SOHO has at least a one hour wait, we decided to just eat here as we were starving after a 9-10 hour flight from San Diego.  We got seated right away after being greeted by the host.  It was still pretty packed inside, with a good mixture of locals and tourists.  Anyhow, it's got a bit of a hip ambiance along with minimalistic decor inside.  Seems like they have a small little section dedicated to retail sales as well (we sat right next to the shelf) for some of their condiments, etc.I'm a fan of shepherd's pie.  And I am also a huge fan of duck.  They happened to have a special that night with duck stuffed inside the pie.  Double whammy!  The portion was just right and didn't overstuff my belly.  We also tried their chicken skewers, which came with a side of bread and some basmati rice underneath.  The skewer was cooked alright as there could have been a little more flavor to be added.  The carbs helped fill us up though.If you're looking for a quick fix just to get your stomach satisfied then you'll be okay here.  But for the prices you're paying for each entree, you are much better off going to a better restaurant around the area.

3M0xXFOH0RPTfvFf6rJDNg.text: I love it! I was there in London and also in Brighton. I am in love with their bluberry pancakes, but their "salt" vegetarian brekfast was amazing. Everybody should try this company and their food. For bonus are very nice and kind staff and stylish place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

ikSGkZcLOI3ugoPbyd-2pA.text: Excellent food service and atmosphere.  Great place for breakfast, dinner and destroy. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

CQ7Af4TFW6T78GTa-O6EzA.text: The gluten-free menu is great. Rarely do I get such a selection of foods (including an amazing brownie for dessert). The ambiance is cool, and the price is affordable, especially for its neighborhood. They also have a nice mixed drink menu.

_yZ5xZ8RQkLRc3Ey4QviTQ.text: Great spot for brunch and lunch! Very busy but food & service was great! Atmosphere good - Mushroom soup over salty but other than that, brunches and burgers were awesome!

7Wib7GVo0spMQSCzkvLbaQ.text: Best breakfast of our trip and what a welcome surprise. Delayed flight meant we didn't have time to explore our immediate neighborhood on Friday as planned so we left our hotel room Saturday morning a bit unsure of where to head. We'd walked past Bill's the night before so when it came up on Yelp we decided to give it a try. The vegetarian Full English was amazing though I liked the avocado side better than the hummus side. Wanted to go back but never got there though we did see another location in Covent Garden when we returned to London a week later. Allergy-friendly/gluten-free options.

lZa9N0TDj3vvK2Anv6ODYg.text: Food was great and our waiter was very helpful for us American's in London.  The atmosphere is inviting and modern.

Z76Zx7J_IHy3cKeMmd9vuQ.text: Ambiance was great and food was delicious. They even had healthy choices. I will definitely return.

NoW1MiYTCzHPGMwc86tuOg.text: Unfortunately we were too late for their breakfast, which is apparently their stronger suit, and ended up having a pretty mediocre lunch. Nothing to ride home about. Small appetizer portion, calamari overbreaded, halloumi salad bland and over-wilted, fries meh, mac and cheese kind of gross, fish sandwich boring. We might have had better luck with the first meal of the day...

KDD0Rxct3Z-Y1VzoeK4aag.text: Delicious English Breakfast with an American Homestyle feel and English cafe flair. Excellent service with little to no queue, (wait to be seated, here in London). Bill's is a charming restaurant (both in the NJ/NYC and London called a greasy spoon) in London's Piccadilly Circus. Here you will find a large variety of English fare from my favorite English breakfast to dinner, pastries and puddings. Plus a variety of drinks to tempt the taste buds. When visiting Piccadilly Circus be sure to check out Bill's. And if your an American on holiday, and crave a little of home. Bill's will make you feel like your back in a trendy NYC breakfast cafe.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. My English Breakfast (friend eggs, Coventry sausage, bacon, tomato, mushroom, and toast. Plus baked beans & Crispy Potato
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. A brilliant cup of Earl Grey
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. View from my table

LvWF5Ilmp7A-f6btawGM4g.text: Arrived in Piccadilly Circus after a trans Atlantic flight. We looked for a traditional English Breakfast and found this place.Around 10-11am on a Thursday and we popped right in and had pleasant service.Foreground is of Bill's Breakfast and across the table is Bill's Vegetarian.It was a good meal.There were some items we didn't care as much for - probably because we aren't used to them. The bacon was great, but the sausage was a little too authentic than what we have in the US where ours is mostly fat and cleaner pieces of meat. This was softer, more delicate and made me really wonder what parts of the pig I was eating. Beans are tomato based too- we're used to more of a BBQ sauce. And then we tried blood pudding- that'll be a one time thing. Nothing wrong with this place though. They did really well on the poached eggs. I would imagine the sausage and beans are pretty much the same as other places around. Just nothing wowed us like most of our other meals did in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Breakfast for me, and Bill's Vegetarian in background.

iaw7oDQCacDtrZJOmH52zA.text: On our way to the Royal Observatory, we decided to stop doe breakfast at this place.  Quirky decor and nice staff.  We order drinks and two places for us.  Food was okay but I enjoyed myself.  I think I may have ordered something different than eggs and bacon with toast.

iohJRc7-EVJWXIgoY-o5Gw.text: First off the service was amazing. Quick, efficient, and never kept me waiting. I had the buttermilk chicken burger - it's overflowing with chicken and the slaw balanced it out perfectly. Fries came out piping hot and fresh and there's a lot of interesting decor with a nice playlist. What's not to love?

mqx9yn2ehK4hA15_FZYSpg.text: This place has some of the best breakfast I ever had. Service was very fast and food very tasty. I couldn't make up my mind, so I ordered two things:  Eggs and Toast w/ Smoked Salmon; Buttermilk pancakes with strawberries, bananas and blueberries. of course I couldn't finish it all!! But I give the food 5 stars alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

vC3p_Yxol7deWAvrSDgWFA.text: Great place and vibe. Probably a little harsh but the main ingredients in my and my wife's dish (avocado) was not ripe so was a little hard. Other than that - great breakfast. Would recommend the avocado toast with bacon. Pancakes were a little dense - need to be more light and fluffy - plus need a little more generous dose of maple syrup.

GpD3QfqHCOMSpyPtr9S2Bw.text: I really liked that they serve the tea in gynormous pots :) the portions were really big in general. The porridge was too big for me to finish, pretty nice but nothing special. We also ordered the avacado toast( also pretty big) but the bread was a little bit too long toasted & too dry but not bad.The prices are very reasonable & the staff are friendly

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill for two
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Avacado toast
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Porridge with banana, honey & hazelnut

N124l-EJELG-VFFKp3mTjg.text: I first heard about Bill's as a brunch staple, but was reluctant to try it since it's a chain. But, my boyfriend made dinner reservations here last week before a show at the Gielgud, and I was super impressed. It's a rustic-glam eatery (think wooden benches and glittery chandeliers) and this juxtaposition creates a really pleasant dining environment. The menu is equally great, and has good British food with a trendy twist down to a science.Obviously, I liked Bill's from the start. But just when I thought my life couldn't get any better, I noticed the halloumi burger on the menu - halloumi being perhaps my greatest discovery on this Eurotrip of mine - and decided to try it. Slices of roasted halloumi and a red pepper sat over a bed of rocket, with hummus and greek yogurt dipping sauce on the side. Delicious! The chips that came with weren't bad either, though I preferred the sweet potato ones that came with my boyfriend's buttermilk chicken burger.Service was great, as well - our waiter joked with my (obviously) American boyfriend, our food was prepared quickly, and we weren't left waiting for the bill.Don't think any less of this place because it's a chain - Bill's offers a healthy, creative menu and welcoming service that would be appreciated in any trendy London eatery. And you can bet I'm coming back here for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Hallou - it's mi (ha food puns!!!)  Top: buttermilk chicken burger. Bottom: halloumi and hummus burger.

f3i6mai4sZshHwCdFJJXIg.text: A great location for a brunch! Have been there on Saturday with friends and we've been overwhelmed by the great service, delicious food and gorgeous interior design!

GhDglcOpyVV6kQvs8kQX_Q.text: OK Bill's!  This little tasty treat was recommended by a friend as we were planning to travel across the pond.  I have to say, I wasn't really looking for it, but stumbled across it while shopping... and remembered the great guidance.  Bill's did not disappoint!  The décor and atmosphere is busy, eclectic, and fun.  The service was super friendly and fast.  The menu delightfully full of old favorites and some new English combos.  I will say that during both visits, the restaurant was pretty full... but we never had to wait for a table.  I really enjoyed the fried chicken burger with slaw... so yummy!  The salads were also tasty... and one of the few places in London I found some solid guacamole and chips.  Thanks Bill's!

vpkBBYp5nkgh8N6Xjesqdg.text: Came here for breakfast during a quick 24-hours in London. My local friend said it was her favorite, so I knew I had to try it. (It also didn't hurt that Bill is my dad's name :)) The service was good- some of the best I had during my Europe trip. The food cam out super quick and was super delicious. I ordered tea, and pancakes with fruit on top. As I was eating, I kept wishing that this place would be transplanted to Florida. I can't even explain, the pancakes were kind of light? but just so good! Definitely, stop by if you're ever in the area. Oh super reasonably priced too! My friend and I both ate for less than 20 pounds.

dm7Matco2oaxwOYh-DC2pw.text: Fast and delicious breakfast and espresso. I will be coming again before heading back to the states.

b9yHLVWe5cst89fcxJNYDQ.text: I loveeeee this place and everything about it Makes me feel like I'm back home service and the food was all really good -definitely my morning spot. Eggs over easy pancakes and even the smoothie we're just awesome plain and simple

iI92shHTRP_EAl0MIy351w.text: I intended to try the breakfast club but the line was way too long. We ended at Bills and it turned out to be quite great. I like the avocado on toast - the toast was crispy and the avocado was good but not that soft. The sausage was meaty.The pancake was not that warm and fluffy though. The service here was not that "friendly" I would say probably because they r too busy at Sunday morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Avocado on toast, sausage on side; pancake
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Latte

IjfLMueo0o_aeAlEqJvafA.text: Nicely decorated and good food! Great place to come for a pot of tea and breakfast with some classic English options. Only qualm was service was a little slow to get to us and not very attentive, but the food came out fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

4hGZ0b8KIe8xIJOxhS0Hhw.text: Horrible service. Fish is over cooked and I could not even eat it, I'm not a picky eater at all. So I felt weird and apologized a million times but I had to take it back and ordered something else to replace my meal. We all waited for the second order and they charged me for both, and then took forever to get us the check. If you're visiting here and come here for dinner be prepared to spend most of your evening here, which sucks for people on holiday. Apparently there brunch is good

EUo4Zar_1rOC9aSqTsi1wQ.text: Ok spot. Kids meal (3y) was way too big. Minute steak was not so good. Shepherds pie was good. Decor is nice and great location. Nothing amazing here that we could tell.

ox7RmohF9UWJKXgkcX131Q.text: Such a great experience! The food was delicious and the staff was so friendly and so kind! The best dining experience while in London!

fXhNYTgJbMAbshk8EMgtHA.text: Our favorite breakfast spot in Soho! We went twice on our last visit, the place was packed but we were accommodated immediately and without much fuss. Service was fast, all dishes were delicious, and the staff were efficient and helpful.

UcInOJRA1bITxPd52H-GEg.text: I have been here twice now & the food & the service was very good. I ordered the Thai chicken green curry , very good !! Cute place

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The buttermilk chicken sandwich
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Thai chicken green curry

rb0jQmp17ViXrtd4DeekQw.text: We visited Bill's for tea last week, and then for lunch a couple of days ago. Here are my thoughts:Ambiance is really nice and we loved the rustic feel. More importantly this restaurantBill's is very clean and not too noisy. Try to get a table near one of the open windows, if the weather is nice.Service is amazing. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Food came out quickly both times.Food is overall quite good.-- Burger was well received by my daughter (portion size isn't too big, her tiny 11-year-old self polished it off in about 5 minutes).-- Seabass with avocado and tomato is pretty good. I wouldn't say the seabass is the best quality though so I don't think I'd order this again.-- Afternoon tea is beautifully presented and quite tasty. The scones and sponge cake were good.-- Husband polished off a brownie dessert...apparently it was very good.Overall we enjoyed eating at Bill's both times and look forward to returning.

ggBZtfv31cgV4ZM3RyDECg.text: I got a chance to visit this place when I was in London and I gotta say the food was really good. Although my breakfast was pretty basic and looked small, it was still filling and well made, as an American were used to large portions but my plate was just right to where I finished the whole thing. The servers were nice and welcoming even when they found out I was an American eating by myself. Also the decorations and the whole restaurant itself was really awesome, it gave away a hipster/indie vibe to it. I would definitely come here again if I were to go to London again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

U_UiLN5oPQ_aIEldP951rw.text: My buddy and I ended in Camden a few times and we ended up at this spot for a much needed lunch.I didn't like that the beers listed on this menu were only available in a bottle at this spot. They should say so on the menu. Also, you couldn't mix the special appetizers with the ones on the regular menu.Overall, the food was just ok and the service was lackadaisical at best. Granted, we came mid afternoon but you'd think you'd get better service and food no matter what time you came in.

tE1aadwTPNKVbQ1ntOaIKg.text: We sat for almost 45 minutes with no food. We ordered avocado toast for one person and a link of sausage with friend egg for the other. That's not time consuming to make. And yet. Everybody around us who came after us got their food first. Then we told the waiter to bring our check with our meal so we could leave fast. Instead he canceled the entire order. So now it's been 40 minutes sans food. Then we wait another 5 minutes for the actual food. I asked them to comp I bc of how much they inconvenience d us. They did. Food was also small and bland.

LJmbbn6rWlPGNzkv3Gqnkg.text: Really great place for a late breakfast on a weekday, especially since the line for The Breakfast Club was out the door.The ambiance is great--big, open and airy, with plenty of comfortable seating.The food is really good--portions are just right, and the eggs Benedict were really tasty. The cappuccinos were delicious!Qnly 3 stars because of the service. Our server brought out our food before she brought our drinks. We asked for our eggs well done, and when we had to send them back because they were runny, she never brought them back until I was almost finished with my meal and my husband went to the front counter to ask about his. Then she ignored us until my husband was on his last couple of bites to see if it had been redone properly. This is a case where having to earn a tip makes sense.Too bad.

gBND1mHMuVDRVv1HqjtfCw.text: I ordered the hamburger and my girlfriend got the ancient grains bowl. I was very very pleased with the hamburger and fries. The burger and toppings were fresh. The steak fries were delicious. My girlfriend ordered the ancient grains bowl which was also to satisfaction. Great value. Our service was great and we were both happy with our meals

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

pwKMwACQfcXJJq45OWm4_g.text: Very nice deco, great little restaurant, we had 3 orders to be shared with 2 people, traditional English Breakfast, food is superb with a very reasonable price.Will definitely come back for more treat.

zMWYY6LhnheSe4DEuqrCpg.text: What a great place!  The coffee was good, atmosphere was eclectic and the food really hit the spot.

wXeZSvaSdYk0GKDgcVusWA.text: Place is cute and super popular. Service started out very good. We got our drinks and coffee quickly and they were all good. Also, appetizers came out quickly and were tasty. Then we waited and waited for our main dishes. A waiter asked if we were ready for the check. Turns out our orders weren't even sent to the kitchen. So we wait some more. Dishes finally came out. Poached eggs were cold. Sandwich and soup were tasteless and poorly presented. Grain bowl was bland. Definitely wouldn't return or recommend.

0DgOT4hCsZIsV6ZzjwaRWQ.text: We had a lovely time at Bill's. We were in Piccadilly on a Friday night and it was very busy. We put our name on the list for a table and were told it would be about a half hour. We arrived back prior to the half hour and were seated. Service was prompt, our server, Savannah was wonderful, and the food was fantastic. We were a party of four and we all had a great time! We would definitely recommend Bill's!

Dzkp6JBuupfOEzSkCXF09Q.text: Popular brunch spot - food was okay, coffee was good. But service was extremely poor - don't know what was our waitress problem where she basically ignore us the entire time since we sat down.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

VhobhluEkkkavWvu61XQZg.text: While visiting London, I decided to stop into Bill's for a quick breakfast before my journey home. The staff was incredibly accommodating, the service was prompt, and the food was absolutely delicious. I couldn't have asked for a better experience, to be quite honest. I ordered the vegetarian breakfast with a mocha, and everything was wonderful. I especially enjoyed the pesto-poached tomatoes. I'd never heard of such a thing before, but thoroughly enjoyed the flavorful surprise.

q4NW24m5l_cPyQzXqS-CIQ.text: Really great little breakfast spot tucked in a neighborhood in Soho near Piccadilly Circus. Extremely friendly folks, top-notch food and super quick for the before work crowd.Really enjoyed their eggs and salmon, a strong cappuccino and even their extreme green smoothie. Super cool ambiance as well. Definitely check this place out if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Eggs and salmon on toast. Amazing.
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Cappuccino deliciousness.

TGdyOyp5cC5UUYxx-_QX1A.text: Fantastic place to eat with friends. Great food, outstanding service and fun atmosphere. Small menu but the food is excellently prepared. They offer Mediterranean and vegetarian options. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Excellent food, great service and fun atmosphere in Piccadilly Circus, London.   Mediterranean and vegetarian options. Highly recommend.

UsWggeqEoU0hCACPFued3g.text: Eggs Royale was best breakfast in forever. Gorgeous orange yolks, perfectly poached that once combined with salmon, muffin & hollandaise sauce made for a perfectly balanced plate. Staff friendly & professional. Everything on point.  Very enjoyable breakfast; will definitely be back next time in London!

mLvldOlm5gDeZqIg0hUiXw.text: Our fave London-SOHO Brunch so far!Easily found on our (Brewer) street, this casual country breakfast is in the heart of SOHO.  We were seated quickly, and quickly served our first drink orders - even though it was prime Sunday brunch hours!  The good service continued throughout our meal.Bill's Breakfast included fried eggs on toast, w tomatoes and mushrooms, thick full-flavored bacon, with tasty small sausage links. Perfect!My wife enjoyed the Scrambled Eggs w Bacon, which was served on toast and proved very filling for less than £5!  Drink options ranged from coffee & tea, to soft drinks and shakes (try the Choco-Brownie Milkshake!), and limited cocktails (the Bramble Mojito will blow your Cuban mindset right into the English countryside!).The puddings have enough high-joule ingredients and flavor to hang with any dessert - anywhere!  We loved it, and I highly recommend Bill's!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The silverware is ready to roll, on every table.
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate Brownie milk-shake; yumm!
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Breakfast!

hFRyayXkng01Gb8iCOCtkg.text: Our friends posted a few pictures of food from Bill's on the last trip to London - and I just knew that I had to give it a try!It's a nice local's place (at least this location had no tourists but us).  The decor is rustic and fun, it's clean and we were seated immediately.  Overall the service was a little slow, but not horribly.We ordered Eggs Benedict, Bill's Breakfast, the Children's Buttermilk Pancakes, English Breakfast tea, a Flat White and a Hot Chocolate.  My Eggs Benedict was pretty good - not as heavy as what I am used to in the States, but I still liked it.  I actually only got to eat half of it - because my 6 year old polished off the second English muffin, ham and the deep golden poached egg on top!  My husband liked Bill's breakfast, and we all shared my son's pancake, which was topped with powdered sugar, syrup and assorted (really good) fresh fruit.  The food was delicious - simple, yet the good ingredients shined.  I wish I could visit again before leaving London to order a toast topped with avocado and a few other things (I got jealous of what a few other patrons ordered!)

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict and English Breakfast tea.
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Nice casual decor

ts0pKEnC7X1fHpZmgcxszw.text: BEST lamb burger you will ever have. i always order it swapping the bun for more salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. eggs benedict with avo side. left the sauce off but the ingredients were yummy lol
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. lamb burger no bun. came to bills and ordered this every other day while on vacation
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. lamb burger with no bun and side salad instead of fries. best burger ive ever had even without the bun!!!!

_KwNsM-txLjPHHltlQWriw.text: Amazing place, very cosy decor. Staff very nice, trustful... perfect. Fresh ingredients that make the meals amazing... i deeply recommend this place

mlQiBsRApzcd5h8quHLBDg.text: Visiting London looking for British food.  The Beef Wellington and Fish fish was tasty.  Nice atmosphere and vibe.

5wcYIvMQoaWAODlD5ievCg.text: Came here for some traditional English breakfast! I got a side of beans to go with my breakfast.  The beans reminded me of the pork and beans you get in a can which i love. The eggs unfortunately was a tad overcooked. I was expecting a leaky yolk. Overall being that it was my first time in london I throughly enjoyed my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English breakfast with a side of beans
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

7_9xb0xRG0mt3MN961AjQA.text: The decor is fun -- Bill's is going for shabby chic. Service is always pleasant and quick. The food doesn't blow me away but it isn't dreadful. Just a bit expensive for what it is. Like other yelpers if Bill's was 2 pounds cheaper I would give this place 4 stars. The risotto is particularly fine.

KPSAYjQq9uT8jJSlhEaCNg.text: We came here right after our flight landed in Heathrow. Our check in for our apartment was supposed to be at 1 PM, however it was delayed until 2 PM and we wanted to kill some time and head somewhere but wanted to make sure that they could accommodate us with all of the luggage that we had. We walked into Bill's and they found a perfect table for us in the back where we could leave our luggage next to us without it being in the way of anybody elses table. We ordered the tortilla chips that came with tzatziki, guacamole, and salsa. It was around £3 but the portion was fairly small for 6 of us, probably should have ordered another one. I ordered the BBQ pork ribs which tasted very good, quite messy but expected. Our waitress was very nice and the staff was very accommodating as well.

fIFSw2yEGDmFucb7KFwoNw.text: Delicious, as ever! I love Bill's. I seriously recommend the Halloumi and hummus burger - it's amazing!Definitely get it with the sweet potato fries though, they are to die for!The prosecco is nice too, and its not too expensive. All in all a lovely place to eat and not too loud so good place to catch up with someone and chat!

-pEsL7fwqdCG3QMAuohSog.text: Very nice experience... perfect place and the price is good... we had breakfast there and it was excellent...

dg67eYSN1x5AkbC_auTeUQ.text: Really nice place, great atmosphere and environment, great staff and food/Coffee/juice. Had bill's breakfast with beans, youghurt and granola and be sure to Try the excellent "green" juice. Normally we dont come to the same place everyday, but it could happen here. Notice it's fair priced, but in the High end

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Brilliant taste
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Smuk udsigt

rogovxMGFTWOMIJ1AkteFA.text: This is a favourite brunch haunt for me - I like the relaxed decor and atmosphere, the casual and friendly (quite American in style) service and their lovely brunch menu...I love that it's not an endless exercise in frustration to get a table at their spacious restaurants and I really appreciate being able to linger on at my table after a generous portion of brunch, smoothie, coffee, etc.This is the one place where I actually felt envious seeing my friends ordering the vegetarian breakfast set while I was eating my standard meaty breakfast...so I had their veggie breakfast and I love it! Their green smoothie is tasty, albeit a bit pricey. It's my default place of choice when I make brunch plans and can't be bothered to conduct some research on cool new places to brunch at...

yUFKs7T76BBOv0l8yZrjmg.text: Excellent lunch. Grilled Halloumi (sp) was wonderful. The cinnamon mini donuts were also a highlight. Fun atmosphere (can get a bit loud) and reasonable price. I would return.

7rnHrt_jpqufcrbMR7vubA.text: Had brunch here on Saturday, very accommodating of my very active toddler and I! Nice and affordable kids menu - bonus. Had Eggs Royale, delicious but quite pricey for portion size. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere, would recommend.

lmt12pXC2PRNMdLBHmlxXQ.text: My favorite chain in London.  I try to mix it up when I'm there but when I'm not feeling like being adventurous and need something good to eat with consistently good quality I look for Bill's.

SwMiz5i5AbEuLmlKEgLxww.text: This place is fine. It is not four stars. The food is ok the service is standard but I was expecting a bit more with four stars on yelp. It was all very standard, wasn't bad but wasn't great at all- good if you just want an English breakfast though.

mxvp_TJkWt5mA4PbvNqkBQ.text: I've just finished an interesting conversation about Bill's in Soho - about how hit and miss it is.I've had one lovely meal there (a lovely chargrilled prawn salad with puy lentils and mango) and one awful (a macaroni cheese that was so watery I had to send it back). Will I give it another go? Probably. The brunch menu looks epic and it's at the end of the road, plus you can always book a decent-sized table and for Soho prices aren't too bad. I have had better Bill's in Bath (ut had to wait ages for a table) and Reading (yet the customer service was painfully slow) though, so I guess nowhere's perfect!

5Uv3y1ULhHEfs-U7Hlva2w.text: Aside from a minor black pudding related issue our breakfast experience was very good. Incredibly friendly staff, lovely interior, good atmosphere and high quality ingredients. I recommend this place.

F-xGkBrutoH9PSb-KfQDGw.text: Cute and satisfying afternoon tea that doesn't cost a fortune!Also great brunch. I like the pantry-chic atmosphere,

4wMBqxdrFF-u8Oy05zVzMQ.text: Visited 2 times while on vacation in London - both great experiences. Had a mix of veg, vegan, and meat-lover dishes (Hard to find a kale salad here... Or a salad in general). Location, service and food were awesome.

lslpT2d-j_wh6WZznUUzeQ.text: Very busy slow cooking, went as a single for a quick lunch.  Focus seemed to be on the groups they certainly were served before me even though they arrived after.Possibly should have taken the hint when they were hesitant on finding a table.  Food delay explained as dropped food hence the double waiting period.  Good view of many people being served with the same selection I made, seems if they cock up you get bumped back.All in all don't plan a quick lunch can't say much about the food yet still waiting !!!  OK food arrived forty mins after order.  Sausage in honey, hot little less brown than I like but good,  fish finger sandwich ok.   Sausage starter was comped at check time as apology for very slow service.

_4imWWLqWPNW70gonZ87wg.text: Spot on breakfast, coming from an American tourist. Decent prices, clean place, good service and great food. Sausage was extra good as well as the apple juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bills Breakfast with tea and juice.

cbJrUhvrX7Y3eEl05IN37w.text: This place is the cutest...hipster with a shabby chic interior - what's not to love. Anyway they're known for their burgers but we opted for their afternoon tea.  Best choice ever!  Prices are reasonable and service is good.  Their menu offers something for everyone.

gk6h4QLiO1RPeOlhmAlLrA.text: Strange mix of food options. Pretty good quality but nothing to write home about.

4UHvLTZyOC5LSk8s5BKOEg.text: New favorite Sunday brunch spot! I love everything about it - breakfast & lunch items, afternoon tea, atmosphere, candle light, cute decoration, even the prices are cheap!!LOVE IT!

Hvef594pddF-w_jvVH5H4A.text: We had the most amazing burgers and fries here. Also loved the milkshake and the atmosphere was so much fun! This is a great place in the neighborhood and a great alternative for a low key night!

1hQSeioZS41rLTU4SNLZYA.text: Book a table or you might not get seated any time soon. Weekdays booking the day before was sufficient for me. Good food great decor and very friendly staff. Didn't had anything on tap but the bottle house options were ok too. I would return to the place.

_zeTc_T6WPaROZ5IQNRMAg.text: Came here for breakfast and loved it! Even our 2 year old daughter who is very picky ate a lot of different things that we ordered! Great ambiance, food and service. Will be back!

04rpQDByAcCv6LOctzrccA.text: Just stopped in for brunch and was ecstatic to find that they had a gluten-free menu! I had Eggs Benedict on gf bread and the gf brownie (just because I could) which came with vanilla ice cream and a heavenly chocolate sauce. The brownie was out of this world. If I lived here I would be a regular!

uHmQVNWPv9LEKPr02tiazQ.text: We came here last night for a quick bite before a show. I've always thought of Bill's as quite a laid back place so didn't think to ask if it would be fine for me to have a full meal and for my friend to just have some bread and olives. However, turns out they only have a license for it you order full meals (or a starter each) We had already ordered our drinks and the waitress was quite rude about it but the manager came over and sorted it straight away offering us a mezze on the house, which was so delicious we ordered another. Seriously olives the size of apples!Was impressed by her quick thinking and sorting of a tricky situation. However, one gripe: the candlelit dinner for two is a great deal but why no veggie option?

CvRVSnn7BDevxUWCngJ2xQ.text: We wanted to go to the Breakfast Club round the corner, but after turning up at 10am in the pouring rain and speaking to the front man at the queue. We discovered it was just a 45 minute wait just to get in the door! We used Yelp to help find this place...Straight in, seated and in a window seat... happy days. The staff were friendly and water was brought over while we decided what we would like. There was only one thing that we wanted.. a lovely cooked brekkie perfect for a Sunday morning hangover.The place is has a great buzz about it, its quite large and is surrounded by some interesting decor and things hanging from the ceiling. It keeps you entertained while waiting for the food to come. We were definitely feeling good at this point dodging the queue of Breakfast Club.I'd order the breakfast with beans which was only £1 more and I'd asked for something instead of mushrooms to which I received extra bacon + bubble and squeak! (Usually another £1) so I was super happy. The egg tasted amazing and was perfectly cooked. The complimentary B+S tasted delicious. The bacon was how bacon should be and it all worked together so well. The only thing that I thought was a bit weird was that they delivered 2 half slices of bread 1 toasted and 1 not toasted. Must be an aussie thing? The whole experience was great and the super powered hand dryer (Better than Dyson Air blade) in the toilet on departure was just the entertainment I needed before being dragged round the shops on Oxford Street by my girlfriend.I'm working my way up to the breakfast club.  From what I have heard I think it will be the pinnacle of my breakfast career in London so far. Bills was a great stop climbing the cooked breakfast mountain on a search for the Great British Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The breakfast

9qe7cMhqLQmQNUgVBKLoOg.text: Bill's has a casual and rustic feel and was a great way to start the weekend. Upon arrival we were seated immediately around 1130am. We had a seat near the window and had a grand time watching people try to squeeze their cars in the tiny spots out front. The healthy breakfast board was tasty but I would have preferred if the granola and yogurt were combined for me already in a bowl. The yogurt comes in a tiny glass and the granola comes in another jar. The fresh fruit was sweet and ripe! Overall though, good service and good food.Bill's healthy breakfast board granola, honey, english natural organic yoghurt  & fresh fruit skewersFree range poached eggs on toasted english muffin - benedict, sliced ham, hollandaise & pumpkin seeds

aJ4t113iI3YVH4YwtbpgCw.text: Great restaurant! From the country chic decor, the service, and obviously the food! We ordered the chorizo cod and chicken skewers, both great Very tasty. The crew is very friendly. Note: no mixed drinks, but that didn't bother me.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

IJmA_cxBtKkhDWT7vg619Q.text: Wow! What an amazing place! I'm normally very fed up with burgers, have had it too much lately. But fell for it again and orders their Bill Burger with bacon and cheese. Wow! That was the best burger in the world! If you go here you have to get it!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Best hamburger in the world!

m49a5v2zBydHdOBQmeGA0g.text: Ugh. £43 for three people for a very ordinary breakfast with weak coffee. Sort of a TGIF or Ruby Tuesday's sort of middle of the road fare. Overcooked eggs.  Nothing exceptional.  Fake American decor, which is always cheesy in the UK.  Service was okay.  I wouldn't really bother to go here unless you like "meh" for breakfast.

72wo-Lx8bbPrvHzyrWmNnA.text: Delicious food as always had a spot of lunch, ordered the Buttermilk Chicken burger. Its comes with coleslaw, baby gem lettuce, tomatoes and a tasty chipotle mayo which was the real winner. Also with a side of sweet potato fries. Great spot for a quick bite to eat in a cosy setting for lunch. Even though Bill's is a chain restaurant each branch has it's own different vibe. The staff here are very friendly and attentive. The summer menu looked very yummy even if it didn't match the London weather

SnaJzYPDBrl4cGKimuwtuQ.text: Cool, rustic decor with a delicious breakfast menu. Had the eggs royale (Benedict with salmon) and my friend had Bill's breakfast (big English breakfast plate). Coffee was top. Would totally come back. Great place for breakfast or brunch in Soho.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's breakfast (far) and Eggs Royale (near)
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The bar.

2PDs5JOvvIl8NcOKTstBOQ.text: Great service, great food. The old pots of tea you can order are a nice touch. Staff are very cheerfull, happy and helpfull.

vQ89hesPw0gzoVYkx3LAEQ.text: I'll start by saying I have reviewed a different Bill's and gave it a pretty crap rating. I never planned on returning to any of their branches but a friend wanted to meet up there and I obliged. The actual restaurant is laid out nicely, the decor and set up of the restaurant is pleasant though you do end up sitting very close to the table next to you.Their breakfast menu is pretty standard and they seem to use free range eggs which is good. I ordered eggs florentine with gluten free bread and the hollandaise on the side and my friend ordered the eggs royale. It came out reasonably quickly yet for some reason was already reasonably cold. The hollandaise was the consistency of butter and the spinach looked like it had been blended and mashed... and there was so much of it it was overwhelming. Fresh spinach would've done fine...! The eggs were nicely cooked though, to their credit. The gluten free bread was okay too. The staff almost to the point of annoying. They checked every two minutes if everything was okay and if we needed anything else, it was a bit much when we were trying to have a conversation and it was literally every two minutes!  After they took my plate away they did come back and asked what was wrong with the spinach as I hadn't eaten it. When I said i wasn't that much of a spinach person they said... well you did order a spinach dish. Yes, but I didn't expect it to look like it'd been chewed and thrown up again! I guess me and Bill's just ain't going to have a love affair. I find it very sub-par.

_hFaGgbspD5dj1n4TIRfnA.text: Anyone who knows Brighton knows Bills.  There's a few kicking around not only in London and Brighton now, but all over. Reading, Devon... This is the latest in the long line of Bills. Opened up on Brewers street a couple of months ago and they've done a good job. Prime, watch the world go by position in this Soho corner. It's big. There are lots of tables but comfortably apart so you don't feel you're sitting on your fellow diners. The Menu is really simple and varied and the vegetarian options are, OK. When I asked my lovely waitress what the non meaty options were, she pretty much said 'we've got a few but the hallumi and hummus burger is the only thing'. So, with my lovely nice window seat catching up with some friends I decided to defy that suggestion and went for the macaroni cheese. If I'm honest, it was a bit dry. But it had a nice flavor and was the right portion size. Next time however I will go with the waitress suggestion, The Mrs had (for starters) a fish pie which she tells me is utterly amazing, fresh and overall yum yum. That was followed by a very disgustingly bad for you peach melba sunday. Proper raspberry coli, big fresh bits of fruit, homemade ice cream. The coffee was also surprisingly gorgeous. This place is really famous for its breakfasts and brunches and also offers cream teas. It has an extensive selection of fresh produce and beer brewed is good ole Lewes. Its goods are also offered in the back of the restaurant in a Bills shop which is always nice if you try something you wouldn't mind taking home. Overall its a nice relaxed spot for brunchy/lunchy gatherings. Unpretentious, great service and lovely fresh food.

zftuWlPWxmgmh7TBGVTbxQ.text: Excellent breakfasts!! My spouse and I just got back from London, and we frequented this place for breakfast at least three times.  The wait staff is extremely friendly and professional, just steer clear of the little dyed blond French waiter.  He has quite the nasty attitude!!

xGraPZ-QhifavwsrdbmgnQ.text: Lovely Saturday afternoon lunch!  I had the halloumi burger and my husband the stew. Both dishes were very good. The atmosphere is busy but fun. Loved the decor! We will return, often. My new favorite.

TGTlctGjm7K6TE8xp6p2zg.text: Good location and great ambiance with clean but small WC. I ordered the chicken  and bacon burger with advacdo dressing.  The chicken was burnt on the underside but overall was ok.  Menu had good choices especially if you like seafood and red meat. For stater I had the flatbread with humus and my partner had Cumberland mini sausages in honey mustard dressing, both delicious.  The choice of menu reminds me of Jamies Italian which for me has very little choice of what I like! For desert I had the blueberry upside down cheesecake... TOP DESERT!

PsKgU4vZclHi28VDYoskRw.text: Bills in Soho London is in a good location. Nice decor inside  and very clean. For starter was mini Cumberland sausages in honey mustard sauce which was excellent, then my main course was a chicken sandwich but was not too keen on that chicken seemed a little bit burnt to me. The desert I chose was an upsidedown cheesecake, initially I had reservations because it came in a small jam jar, but it was very good and I would definitely recommend that for desert.  Would I go back? Certainly not in a rush to!

v8lvduN9_aRgL64N9mABzw.text: You know, I'm going to bump by review of Bill's up by a star, and it's all because their staff was surprisingly amazing this past weekend.Let's be honest, I still have many of the same peeves about Bill's as before: the food is only 'ok' and the prices are a little much, and around noon on a weekend you can kiss the idea of walking in the door and getting a table goodbye.But we've found that for Saturday breakfast, this place is really quite cosy. And the range of gluten-free options is really nice; makes things easier on me, and I don't have to ask the staff a thousand questions they don't have time for. They're actually all very savvy, along the lines of "if you're gluten intolerant, don't get the sausage, it has rusk in it", etc. So rare to find that anywhere. Also, their porridge is super good and not overly-sweet the way some places make it, and a great choice for when the weather cools down.This past weekend, there happened to be a small mix-up with my order, aka both our flat whites came with dairy milk instead of the soya we'd requested. At first the server was confused because he was sure he'd ordered soya at the counter (apparently the person making the drinks mixed them up) but then he was super apologetic, and brought over the manager, who was also genuinely concerned that we were ok. Things would have been a little unpleasant had we not noticed, so it was nice to see that the error was taken seriously. I felt a little embarrassed when they actually comped both our meals, but talk about great customer service. You rarely see that in London, and it definitely warrants acknowledgement.

NB2IX8bfPuh_MoBXJMIOfw.text: Decent spot for breakfast. Large portions. Fresh juice. Excellent eggs and toast. Coffee Americano is okay. Service is polite but slow, even when not very busy. Seems a bit disorganized. Took a while to get seated even though most of the tables were empty.
